body.p: This department was created on March 11, 1862. It was geographically defined by the portions of Michigan, Ohio, Kentucky, and Tennessee east of a north-south line dividing Knoxville, Tennessee, and parts of western Maryland and Virginia. All of Kentucky and Tennessee were incorporated in the Department of Mississippi on June 8, 1862. The Mountain Department was disbanded on June 28, 1862. Commander(s): William S. Rosecrans and John C. Fremont.
